Issues.Title: fix(core): do not use unbound attributes as inputs to structural directives
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit unbound attributes were treated as possible inputs to structural directives. Since structural directives can only accepts inputs defined using microsyntax expression (e.g. `<div *dir="exp">`), such unbound attributes should not be considered as inputs. This commit aligns Ivy and View Engine behavior and avoids using unbound attributes as inputs to structural directives.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: strictTemplates: does not allow coercion of string to number
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
Unsure, probably `@angular/compiler`.

### Is this a regression?
Not that I am aware.

### Description
Say you have an expression in your template that you know represents a number but it's typed as a `string` (e.g. a `select` value). If you want to pass that value to an event handler method or bind it as input, 1) the method parameter/input must be typed as a `string` or 2) you must use `+$any(theExpression)` in the template to coerce the value to a number so the method/input property gets a number value.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-36440

## üî• Exception or Error
Having to use `$any` here is a bit of pain point to me. I think we should be able to coerce the value directly (i.e. `+theExpression`), but doing that results in this error:

```
Error in src/app/app.component.html (6:46)
The left-hand side of an arithmetic operation must be of type 'any', 'number', 'bigint' or an enum type.
```

That's odd because there is no left-hand side here.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "strictTemplates: does not allow coercion of string to number" (#36440)

Issues.Title: Cannot use the service worker in AWS CloudFront with PathLocationStrategy
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/service-worker ### Is this a regression? No, been a issue since release of the service-worker ### Description The [documentation ](https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-devops#fail-safe) says > To deactivate the service worker, remove or rename the ngsw.json file. When the service worker's request for ngsw.json **returns a 404**, then the service worker removes all of its caches and de-registers itself, essentially self-destructing. The problem with this approach is that when running a CDN environments such as CloudFront where the 404 has to be redirected to 200 index.html to support the PathLocationStrategy. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25538602/78503863-8d0e0880-7769-11ea-97bc-6f3e5928fb77.png) The client will never receive a http status code of 404 instead it will get a status code of 200 with the content type `text/html` instead of `application/json`. this leads to that the service-worker is not self-destructing. I found a [old issue that address this problem](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/24827) but it has been closed due to inactivity. There is also a [closed pull request](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/25682) ## üî• Exception or Error

# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/language-service


### Description
When you use `@Attribute` decorator in constructor language service detects it and provides code complete in IDE. It does not provide code complete and warnings are shown for unknown attributes by IDE if it is only used in `deps` in `providers` like I have here:
https://github.com/ng-web-apis/intersection-observer/blob/master/projects/intersection-observer/src/directives/intersection-observer.ts
however code works.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> It would be great if Angular Language Service picked those up.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Adding them to constructor for no reason other than code completion

Issues.Title: Unit test should fail if an element is not known
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Unit test should fail if an element is not known

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/core.
And I think this is a kinda a regression since this behavior changed with Ivy.

### Description
When executing unit tests with Karma and my test module has not been setup correctly, to contain all the relevant components, I get a  warning like this:
```
WARN: ''app-my-element' is not a known element:
1. If 'app-my-element' is an Angular component, then verify that it is part of this module.
2. If 'app-my-element' is a Web Component then add 'CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component to suppress this message.'
```

The test is still successful in that case. In my opinion it should fail, since the test module clearly is missing this component.

I saw that there have been efforts to make it appear as an error: 00f3c58.
This has been reverted in this commit: 00f3c58.

But that wouldn't change the fact, that the test still passes.


### Describe the solution you'd like
I would like one of these options:
* tests with unknown elements fail (as they did pre Ivy)
* an option to enable this behavior to make the tests fail
  * i.e. a CLI argument or a property in angular.json

If the default is "fail", then a user could add `CUSTOM_ELEMENTS_SCHEMA` or `NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA` to their test module if they want to suppress the errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unit test should fail if an element is not known" (#36430)

Issues.Title: fix(core): pipe injecting provider from incorrect context when used in a component input
Issues.Body:
Given a structure of `<parent><child [input]="value | pipe"></child></parent>` the injector that is associated with the pipe will inject as if it's placed inside of the `child` component. The issue comes from the fact that we don't have a `TNode` tied to pipe instances and the current `TNode` points to the `child`.

These changes work around the issue by having a flag that indicates whether we're currently "inside of" a pipe, and if we are, DI is essentially treated as if it has `SkipSelf`.

Fixes #36146.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): pipe injecting provider from incorrect context when used in a component input" (#36428)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): support ignoring deep-imports via package config
Issues.Body:
Recently we added support for ignoring specified deep-import
warnings by providing sets of regular expressions within the
`ngcc.config.js` file. But this was only working for the project
level configuration.

This commit fixes ngcc so that it will also read these regular
expressions from package level configuration too.

Fixes #35750

Issues.Title: fix(compiler): avoid generating i18n attributes in plain form
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change, there was a problem while matching template attributes, which mistakenly took i18n attributes (that might be present in attrs array after template ones) into account. This commit updates the logic to avoid template attribute matching logic from entering the i18n section and as a result this also allows generating proper i18n attributes sections instead of keeping these attribute in plain form (with their values) in attribute arrays.

Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/cdk/text-field` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: as far as I can see it worked in angular 8. But as we know the setup was different then as `cdk` was under `@angular/material`. ### Description Updating my project to angular 9 (from v6) caused the error: ``` ERROR in node_modules/@angular/cdk/text-field/autosize.d.ts:13:22 - error NG6002: Appears in the NgModule.imports of AppModule, but could not be resolved to an NgModule class. This likely means that the library (`@angular/cdk/text-field`) which declares CdkTextareaAutosize has not been processed correctly by ngcc, or is not compatible with Angular Ivy. Check if a newer version of the library is available, and update if so. Also consider checking with the library's authors to see if the library is expected to be compatible with Ivy. ``` when building with aot. I have seen several of these issues raised on the forum here and tried every solution/workaround I have seen. The reason I am posting my own issue here is because I have not seen anyone else having problems with th `@angular/cdk` package. The `ngcc` postinstall script works fine with all other packages, including `@angular/material`. Disabling `aot` or ivy works, but without ivy, what is the point of updating to ng9? I would appreciate any input here. I am quite at a loss at this point. Thanks :) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - new project with `ng new testRepo` - `npm i @angular/material@9.2.0` or `ng add @angular/material` - Add `import { cdkTextAreaAutosize } from '@angular/cdk/text-field';` - and ```ts @NgModule({ declarations: [ AppComponent ], imports: [ BrowserModule, AppRoutingModule, BrowserAnimationsModule, CdkTextareaAutosize ], // <---- this causes the error providers: [], bootstrap: [ AppComponent ] }) export class AppModule {} ``` https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-ysgv8g?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts ## üî• Exception or Error 

ERROR in node_modules/@angular/cdk/text-field/autosize.d.ts:13:22 - error NG6002: Appears in the NgModule.imports of AppModule, but could not be resolved to an NgModule class.

This likely means that the library (`@angular/cdk/text-field`) which declares CdkTextareaAutosize has not been processed correctly by ngcc, or is not compatible with Angular Ivy. Check if a newer version of the library is available, and update if so. Also consider checking with the library's authors to see if the library is expected to be compatible with Ivy.

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): detect non-emitted, non-imported TypeScript helpers
Issues.Body:
When TypeScript downlevels ES2015+ code to ES5, it uses some helpers functions to emulated some ES2015+ features, such as spread syntax. The TypeScript compiler can be configured to emit these helpers into the transpiled code (which is controlled by the `noEmitHelpers` option - false by default). It can also be configured to import these helpers from the `tslib` module (which is controlled by the `importHelpers` option - false by default).

While most of the time the helpers will be either emitted or imported, it is possible that one configures their app to neither emit nor import them. In that case, the helpers could, for example, be made available on the global object. This is what `@nativescript/angular` v9.0.0-next-2019-11-12-155500-01 does. See, for example, [common.js][1].

Ngcc must be able to detect and statically evaluate these helpers. Previously, it was only able to detect emitted or imported helpers.

This commit adds support for detecting these helpers if they are neither emitted nor imported . It does this by checking identifiers for which no declaration (either concrete or inline) can be found against a list of known TypeScript helper function names.

##
This is needed for angular/ngcc-validation#1029.

[1]: https://unpkg.com/browse/@nativescript/angular@9.0.0-next-2019-11-12-155500-01/common.js
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): detect non-emitted, non-imported TypeScript helpers" (#36418)

Issues.Title: Need a way to selectively disable component size budgets
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [X] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
Currently the anyComponentStyle budget applies to all components.  However we have a couple of components that significantly exceed the budget.  We'd like to make an exception for those components, but still get warnings/errors if other components go over budget.

### Describe the solution you'd like
A way to either specify an exception list to the anyComponentStyle budget, or a way to set a per component budget that would override the anyComponentStyle budget for the specified component.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
We've upped our budget, but the components in question are considerably larger than our average, so the budget is now pretty much useless.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/pwa): add purpose any to manifest icons
Issues.Body:
The `purpose` property defines the purpose of an icon, for example if the icon is intended to serve some special purpose in the context of the host OS (i.e., for better integration).

`Purpose` can have one or more of the following values, separated by spaces:

- `badge`: A user agent can present this icon where space constraints and/or color requirements differ from those of the application icon.
- `maskable`: The image is designed with icon masks and safe zone in mind, such that any part of the image outside the safe zone can safely be ignored and masked away by the user agent.
- `any`: The user agent is free to display the icon in any context (this is the default value).

Closes #17384
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/pwa): add purpose any to manifest icons" (#17386)

Issues.Title: Since angular 9 webpack hooks can no longer indicate the end of localized build process
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular v8 ### Description When building angular application using new `--localize` flag, the build process consists of two phases. First one is the webpack compilation and second is the post processing. Because of that after first phase output files land in `/tmp` directory instead of target destination. The problem is, that I've been using a `sentry` plugin that relies on webpack hook - `afterEmit`. Previously that hook allowed the plugin to read target (ex. `dist`) directory and access emitted files. Right now at the time when hook is executed `dist` directory remains empty until post-processing is completed. Of course I could (and I will) write custom node script that will be executed manually (or as a combined npm script) just after `ng build`. Are there plans to put that post processing back to webpack compilation process, or it's going to stay this way? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Let me know if you need a reproduction. It's more conceptual issue ## üåç Your Environment 
Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 10.16.0
OS: linux x64

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new

- [x] add
- [x] update

### Is this a regression?
:+1: 
<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: ....


### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem...

In [release post](https://blog.angular.io/version-9-1-of-angular-now-available-typescript-3-8-faster-builds-and-more-eb292f989428) of angular v9.1

> #### TSLint 6.1 by default
> Newly created projects will now use TSLint 6.1 by default. If you want to migrate to the latest version, make sure you are on version 9.1 first, then you can opt-in via:
> ```sh
> ng update @angular/cli --migrate-only tslint-version-6
> ```

TSLint is deprecated and migration to ESLint is advised according to its docs

Issues.Title: Newly created project cannot lint environment.prod.ts file
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [x] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Not sure ### Description Newly created project cannot lint `environment.prod.ts` file. After setting ```"include": [ "src/**/*.ts" ]``` in `tsconfig.app.json` everything works fine. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create a new project with the CLI and run this command `ng lint --files src/environments/environment.prod.ts` in your terminal. ## üî• Exception or Error 

src\\environments\\environment.prod.ts" is not part of a TypeScript project 'tsconfig.app.json,tsconfig.spec.json,e2e/tsconfig.json
## üåç Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 9.0.7
Node: 12.3.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.0.7
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: ng build --prod changes opacity value of CSS rule on brand new ng new project
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new
- [X] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

I don't know.

### Description

When doing ng build --prod, it changes the opacity value of a css rule.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Create a new project:

PS D:\Projects\Test Projects> ng new cssBug
? Would you like to add Angular routing? No
? Which stylesheet format would you like to use? SCSS   [ https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax#scss

Open file /src/styles.scss

Add the following lines in the file:

```
.mat-form-field-appearance-outline.mat-focused .mat-form-field-outline-thick, 
.mat-form-field-appearance-outline.mat-form-field-invalid.mat-form-field-invalid .mat-form-field-outline-thick {
  opacity: 50% !important;
}
```

Build new project:

PS D:\Projects\Test Projects> cd cssBug
PS D:\Projects\Test Projects\cssBug> ng build --prod

Open /dist/cssBug/style.hash.css.

Look at previously inserted lines. 

Result: opacity has been change from 50% !important to 1% !important.
I have reproduced this 3 times.

## üî• Exception or Error

No Exception. The error is a change in the CSS value of opacity.

Angular 6 version is being used 
 
Below is the configuration - 

**karma.conf.js :**

    module.exports = function (config) {
      config.set({
        basePath: '',

        },

I am getting below error when I run - `mvn clean install`

I have researched a bit and found below links but I havent yet found any solution. 
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/10703#issuecomment-387319138

Please not that we have to do **this from maven only** 

Can anybody please help here as I am struggling to get this running ?

Issues.Title: improve testing capabilities
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
I see that tremendous advancements were already made in the last years, dear Angular Team: Thank you for that!

There is something that I'd like to start a discussion on:

Faster and specific tests.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
- [ x] test

### Description
Looking at just and wallaby.js I really would like to have that by default in Angular when running ng test (in watch mode). 

As I like to keep my applications in standard, I think we all could benefit from improvements like these.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I think the main features are:
- if you change a test, just rerun that specific test
- if you change code, determine which tests are affected and rerun these tests
- if you change code in a spec file other than a specific test, rerun the whole spec
- have a state of tests in memory and show interesting information about it in vs code

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Aquire wallaby.js and integrate it.

Input welcome.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "improve testing capabilities" (#17368)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): `Point` interface is not exported in the public API
Issues.Body:
#### Issue
The `Point` interface:
```ts
/** Point on the page or within an element. */
export interface Point {
  x: number;
  y: number;
}
```
is defined and exported inside [drag-ref.ts](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/drag-ref.ts). This interface is used in the public drag-drop API, e.g.
```ts
@Input('cdkDragConstrainPosition')
constrainPosition: (point: Point, dragRef: DragRef) => Point
```

But `Point` is missing from the [public-api.ts](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/public-api.ts) exports.

```ts
export {DragRef, DragRefConfig} from './drag-ref';
```

...should include `Point` as well.

```ts
export {DragRef, DragRefConfig, Point} from './drag-ref';
```

#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material: 9.2
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(drag-drop): `Point` interface is not exported in the public API" (#19001)

Issues.Title: bug(cdkTextareaAutosize): Animation of height calculates default height wrongly
Issues.Body:
I have a component, A, which contains a textarea, which has the attribute cdkTextareaAutosize.

When I animate the height of A from 0 to * (i.e. the default height). The height of A is animated to the wrong final value which appears like the default height assumes that the height of the textarea is only one line and not the number of lines it actually has.

As soon as the animation completes, the height jumps to the right height.

Therefore I guess, that there is a kind of synchronization problem between computing the height of the textarea by the cdkTextareaAutosize attribute and determining the default height for '*'.

Any hint?

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14.
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3.
- Browser(s): Google Chrome.
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10 Pro
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdkTextareaAutosize): Animation of height calculates default height wrongly" (#18999)

Issues.Title: Combined Input and Select Broken
Issues.Body:
When you combine `<input>` and `<mat-select>` using `<mat-form-field>`, the result is broken when `<mat-select>` **precedes** `<input>`.

However, things work as expected when `<mat-select>` **follows** `<input>`.

#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular9-material-combined-select-input
  
#### Expected Behavior

When combined, `<input>` and `<mat-select>` should behave independently.

#### Actual Behavior

When `<mat-select>` **precedes** `<input>`:

Clicking the `<input>` activates the `<mat-select>`'s drop down.

Moreover, you're unable to select the `<input>` using the mouse. Tab selecting the `<input>` does work however.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.149 (Official Build) (64-bit) 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Combined Input and Select Broken" (#18998)

Issues.Title: build: update buildifier and fix failures
Issues.Body: Our version of `@bazel/buildifier` is pretty old. These changes bump to the latest version and fix the new failures that showed up.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: update buildifier and fix failures" (#18997)

Issues.Title: fix(youtube-player): unable to bind to events after initialization
Issues.Body: The `youtube-player` component is set up so that it won't bind any events if there aren't any listeners at the time the player is created. This makes it impossible to bind an event by getting a reference to the player using `ViewChild` and subscribing to it. These changes fix the issue using a lazy observable which binds any events once the user subscribes and transfers them between players.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(youtube-player): unable to bind to events after initialization" (#18996)

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): add hover indication to navigation buttons
Issues.Body:
The calendar navigation buttons use `mat-icon-button` which explicitly doesn't have hover indication for some reason (see https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/button/button.scss#L13). I'm not exactly sure about the reasoning in `mat-button`, so I decided to scope these changes only to the calendar so we don't cause unexpected behavior.

Fixes #18958.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(datepicker): add hover indication to navigation buttons" (#18995)

Issues.Title: Form-Field `input` and `label` DOM order issue
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
According to WCAG [H44: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H44.html)
> Check that there is a label element that identifies the purpose of the control **before** the input, textarea, or select element

In the Material [form-field](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/form-field/form-field.html#L24) component, the `label` is **after** the `input`

#### What is the expected behavior?
The Material [form-field](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/form-field/form-field.html#L24) renders the `label` **before** the `input` in the DOM according the the WCAG.

#### What is the current behavior?
The form field component renders the `label` **after** the `input` in the DOM. Accessibility tests are failing because of this, and it is likely why JAWS and NVDA weren't reading the labels. IE, `aria-owns` is likely unneeded if the DOM order were corrected.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Use a [form-field](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/form-field/form-field.html) component in your project


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Accessibility and WCAG compliance. You will likely be able to remove the superfluous `aria-owns` attribute as a result, as well.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All of them, I believe... At least 5.X and up.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
That is all. Thank you!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form-Field `input` and `label` DOM order issue" (#18989)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(datepicker): matDatepickerFilter API documentation has incorrect type
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

The API documentation for matDatepickerFilter shows it's type as  `(date: D) => boolean` when it's actually  `(date: D | null) => boolean`.  

It also doesn't explain what conditions would cause it to get called with a null value.  

I noticed the example on the Examples tab does have the correct type, but just does a (d || new Date()) and gives no reason for why null should be treated as the current datetime.

**Affected documentation page:** Insert a link to the affected page on material.angular.io

https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/api#MatDatepickerInput
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/datepicker/datepicker-input.ts#L118
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(datepicker): matDatepickerFilter API documentation has incorrect type" (#18986)

Issues.Title: bug(dialog): JSONEditor inputs not working in material dialog
Issues.Body:
#### Expected Behavior Angular Material dialog with a JSONEditor (https://github.com/josdejong/jsoneditor) object embedded in it would allow editing of text fields in the JSON editor. #### Actual Behavior Angular Material dialog with a JSONEditor object embedded in it no longer allows editing of text fields. Non-text fields work correctly. The JSONEditor object uses a contenteditable div as such: ```
my text
``` rather than an HTML input field. Keyboard input currently is ignored and dragging to select text instead drags the dialog around the window. The JSONEditor object's search field, which is an HTML text input, functions as expected so it's likely some interaction between Material and the contenteditable div that is the problem. #### Environment - Angular: 9.1.0 - CDK/Material: 9.2.0 - Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.149 - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(dialog): JSONEditor inputs not working in material dialog" (#18984)

Issues.Title: fix(core): ripple mutating global options when animations are disabled
Issues.Body: When animations are disabled, the ripple element sets the animation duration of its global options to zero. The problem is that it's mutating the object that's used by all other ripples. The issue can be observed by going to the MDC checkbox demo and then trying to interact with something that should have a ripple.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): ripple mutating global options when animations are disabled" (#18983)

Issues.Title: build: sanitize postinstall patch markers
Issues.Body:
Yarn throws if patch markers with special characters are found
in restored `node_modules`. To fix this, patch markers are now
sanitized to not contain special characters.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: sanitize postinstall patch markers" (#18982)

Issues.Title: build: add lint rule to disallow invocation lifecycle hooks
Issues.Body:
Adds a lint rule that will flag any cases where a lifecycle hook is invoked directly. There's an exception for test files where we need to call `ngOnDestroy` manually on providers, as well as on `super`.

Also fixes a memory leak in the calendar that prompted the rule to be written.

**Note:** not merge safe, because I had to make a change in the calendar to get everything to pass.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: add lint rule to disallow invocation lifecycle hooks" (#18981)

Issues.Title: bug(list): List Item always wraps
Issues.Body:
List items are not able to wrap due to [this pull request](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/13099) which was made to fix action lists clickable area not stretching to full width. I believe the problem is becasue mat-list-item-base mixin is ued in more than just action lists. I'm not sure if this is really a bug since lists are usually vertical, but in our use case this was working, but when we updated @angular/material to v7.x it broke our page on mobile displays.

#### Reproduction

[Example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-q3j8vy)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create List
2. Add `display: flex, flex-flow: row wrap` to list 
 
#### Expected Behavior

#### Actual Behavior

List is always in column format because of
